paragraphs: Queenstown, known as Tāhuna in Māori, was a seasonal gathering area for Māori, especially for hunting and gathering pounamu (greenstone) in nearby rivers.
European settlement began during the Otago Gold Rush in the 1860s. The town quickly grew as prospectors flooded the area in search of fortune.
Today, Queenstown is one of New Zealand’s top tourist destinations, famous for adventure sports, breathtaking landscapes, and its role in film and tourism.
